channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024010486
item.description:
Report E-2024010486

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a UN1760 Muscle Magic release from a 5-gallon poly pail due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 12’ x 15’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pail and material remaining in it were solidified and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010655
item.description:
Report X-2024010655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found on unload, placed in lined tote, and staged for HMPA. The outer packaging was soiled by leakage from another package and/or rain in transit. DescribePack: Upon opening the box, spill incident was discovered. One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 1oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. The tote used for transport to HMPA was lined.

Report E-2024010450

  • Description: 2 cups of UN1824 "LIQUID LAUNDRY BUILT DETERGENT" impacting the trailer floor. Two 5gal pails were punctured by a forklift. No Drains, Soils or Waterway were impacted

item.title: Report X-2024010593
item.description:
Report X-2024010593

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Concealed DG. The shipment was initially offered as UN3077 fully regulated without a Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods. It was returned to the shipper. The shipper reoffered it in a plain brown box. The box was suspected to contain undeclared dg. It was opened to reveal concealed DG. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024010132
item.description:
Report X-2024010132

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The shipment was an all packed in one and the single 500ML glass bottle containing UN2248 was broken spilling inside of the fiberboard box. The fiberboard boxes inside were separated with dividers and styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024010114
item.description:
Report X-2024010114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Dec 27th during the PM sort a package was discovered to be leaking. The package contained 13 aerosol cans and 3 cans of paint. One of the aerosol cans dispersed some of its contents inside of the package. The spill was cleaned up and the package was contained in a steel salvage drum.

Report X-2024010118

  • Description: All Packed In One. Multiple metal cans and glass bottles poorly wrapped in bubble wrap and poorly packed together in fibreboard outer packaging. multiple bottles broken. UN1268 UN1223 UN1593 UN1760. cleaned locally and secured in salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010071
item.description:
Report X-2024010071

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 23rd a package was found during the sort that smelled like fuel and upon further investigation it appears to be some machinery that contains fuel. The closure for the fuel tank was loose and some fuel leaked inside the case. There are no markings, labels or documentation showing this as a regulated dangerous good. The package is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023121105
item.description:
Report X-2023121105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic jerrican was discovered leaking from a loose cap at the MEMH facility. The cap was tightened and the jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for a amended shippers declaration for movement.
